title: SNP and Greens push through workplace parking tax in Scotland
text:
Scotland's councils are to be given the power to tax commuters for parking at work after SNP and Green MSPs pushed through the controversial levy.

The two independence-supporting parties joined forces again to throw out a last-ditch attempt by the other opposition parties to remove the Workplace Parking Levy from a Transport Bill.

In a fiery debate preceding the vote, Nicola Sturgeon's ministers were accused of hypocrisy for approving the tax while charging the public purse for their own work-related travel.

Neil Bibby, a Labour MSP, said commuters would be forced to pay the tax despite nationalist MSPs claiming £300,000 from the public purse in only two years for their own motoring expenses....
description: Scotland's councils are to be given the power to tax commuters for parking at work after SNP and Green MSPs pushed through the controversial levy.
